title: Old Delhi-Style Butter Chicken Recipe
method: 1. To begin with the recipe, you first need to marinade boneless chicken pieces. For this, take a large mixing bowl, add curd, ginger and garlic paste, vegetable oil, lemon juice, chilli powder, black pepper, garam masala and salt. Mix everything.
2. Once done, add chicken pieces and keep the marinade in the fridge for 3-4 hours.
3. Heat 2 Tbsp butter in a grill pan, add all the marinated chicken pieces and cook until brown.
4. Once the chicken is cooked properly, take all the pieces out in a bowl.
5. Melt butter and pour all over the chicken.
6. Mix everything well and sprinkle some chaat masala on the top.
7. Serve with onion rings and enjoy!

title: One Pot Chicken Pasta Recipe
method: 1. Heat olive oil in a pan and saute chicken till it loses moisture. Season it with pepper and salt.
2. Add chopped onion and garlic. Once the onion is translucent, add Italian seasoning, parsley, broth, tomatoes, cream and bring it to a boil.
3. Add the raw pasta and let the pasta cook in the broth. Add more broth, if needed to cook the boiled pasta.
4. Garnish the pasta with parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese and mix it well. The one pot chicken pasta is ready!

title: Satay Chicken Curry Recipe
method: 1. Cooking Instructions: For the marinate (previous night) In a bowl mix the following until it’s runny and set aside: Coconut milk – 100ml Chilli Chutney Peanut Butter – 2 tbsp Brown sugar – 1/2 tbsp Thai Red Curry Paste – 2.5 tbsp Soy sauce – 2 tbsp
2. Add 300 grams of medium size chopped chicken. If you want a faster cook, you can cut the chicken into smaller pieces.
3. Once mixed, let this marinate overnight for about 12 hours so that the chicken absorbs all those nutty flavors and spices.

4. For Spicy Peanut Sauce: In a bowl mix the below ingredients well and set aside: Coconut milk – 400ml Chilli Chutney Peanut Butter – 1tbsp Soy sauce – 2 tbsp Brown sugar – 1 tbsp Thai Red Curry Paste – 3 tbsp Tamarind paste – 1 tbsp Sriracha sauce – 3 tbsp
5. Final Steps: Add 1 tbsp of oil to a hot pan. Add the marinated chicken and let it cook for 6-7 minutes. Once cooked 80%, set it aside in another bowl.
6. Add 1 tbsp of oil to the hot pan again. Add the minced garlic and finely diced red jalapeno. When jalapenos have reduced in size, add the spicy peanut sauce made in step 4.
7. Simmer and reduce till the gravy is thicker, now add the cooked chicken.
8. You can plate this delicious spicy chicken curry on a bed of steamed rice. Garnish with coriander and some red jalapeno.

title: Tamil Nadu-Style Chicken Salna Recipe
method: 1. To begin with the recipe, we first need to make salna paste. For this, heat peanut oil in a large vessel, add fennel seeds, peppercorns, cinnamon stick, cloves and star anise and let them splutter.
2. Once done, add fresh coconut and roast till the coconut turn slightly brown. This roasting process will take about 5-7 minutes. Turn off the flame and set aside to cool.
3. Once cool down, transfer the roasted masala into the mixer-jar and grind to a smooth paste by adding little water. Ps: Do not add too much water.
4. In the same vessel, heat some oil (any oil) on medium flame, add the chicken pieces, turmeric and salt and saute till they turn golden brown, making sure you don't overcook the chicken.

5. Take the chicken pieces out and drain with a paper towel. Add curry leaves to the pan and allow it to crackle. Add in ginger, garlic and saute until for a couple of minutes. Add onion and saute until they turn golden brown. Next add in the tomatoes and sprinkle some salt and cook until the tomatoes become soft and mushy.

6. Then the last step is to add the ground masala paste into the vessel along with all the spice powders-garam masala, red chilli powder and turmeric powder. Give it a good stir and cook until the raw smell of the spice powders goes away.
7. Now, add the chicken pieces into the gravy and add about 1/2 cup of water, salt to taste and simmer for 10 minutes. Your chicken salna is ready!

title: Muthiya Chicken Kebab Recipe
method: 1. First, take a chopper add blend onion, ginger, garlic, mint leaves and coriander leaves.
2. Now, take minced chicken and add salt, red chilli, pepper, coriander powder, chaat masala, garam masala, chopped green chillies, cumin seeds.
3. To this also add the blended mixture. Combine all these well.
4. Now, make small roundels from this and flatten it out.
5. Take a pan and add some water and bring it to a boil.
6. Then add the kebabs in this. Let it cook in the water and then serve!

title: Chicken Katsu Burger Recipe

ingredient.description: mililitres Egg Wash ( egg yolk and water )

method: 1. Cut Burger bun spread with butter both side and toasted.
2. Drizzle Tonkatsu sauce around 30 ml on bottom of the bun.
3. Place iceberg lettuce on top of bottom bun.
4. Place home pickled cucumber & onion slice on top of the lettuce.
5. Place crispy fried burger on top of the pickled veg.
6. Drizzle Tonkatsu sauce top of the fried patty.
7. Place top bun top of patty.
8. Serve it hot along with Fries or salad.

title: Thai Chicken Stir Fry Recipe
method: 1. Take chicken into thin strips and keep it aside.
2. Now, in a bowl add coconut milk, soy sauce, fish sauce, lime juice, chilli flakes and a bit of sugar.
3. Mix this well and add the chicken pieces in it to marinate.
4. Till then in a pan heat oil and add chopped ginger, garlic, red chilli and onions. Let it soften.
5. Now add green beans and mushroom and mix. Once it is slightly cooked, throw in the chicken and the leftover marinating paste.
6. Let it get crisp in the in pan.
7. Finally, when done, take it out and garnish with basil leaves and serve!

title: Stuffed Makhmali Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Mix cream, curd, onion powder, green chili paste, ginger paste, coriander powder, salt, cumin powder, black pepper, cumin powder and roasted gram flour in a bowl.
2. Add chicken pieces to it and let it marinate for 30 minutes.
3. Meanwhile prepare the stuffing. Mix the things mentioned above.
4. Grind the chicken and place the stuffing on it, roll it and put it in the square with capsicum.
5. Put a little oil in a pan and fry it by rotating it from all sides.
6. Serve with favorite chutney.

title: Slow Cooked Chicken Tikka Masala Recipe
method: 1. Take the chicken pieces and lightly season them with salt, pepper, and red chilli.
2. Cook this on a high flame in a pan till brown.
3. Then take this out. Take a cooker and add some oil.
4. Then throw in dry red chillies, bay leaf, two cloves, and star anise.
5. Then add chicken pieces with chopped onion, tomatoes, garlic, and ginger.
6. When it softens, add salt, pepper, cardamom, garam masala, coriander powder, and turmeric powder.
7. Now let this slowly cook for at least two hours. Check it in between to add some water.
8. Once it is thick enough, take it out, garnish with cream and coriander leaves and serve!

title: Achaari Chicken Cutlet Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. To marinate the chicken, put the chicken in a large bowl, add yogurt, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well, cover and put into the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Take it out of the refrigerator at least 15 minutes before frying.
2. In a medium-sized bowl, add the onion and cucumber and then add the lime juice and salt to taste. Cover and set aside for as long as chicken is marinating.

3. To prepare your bread crumbing station, put the flour on a plate and season it with some salt. Crack the eggs in a bowl, add a pinch of salt and whisk. Put the breadcrumbs in another plate and season with a pinch of salt. Set aside until required.
4. To make the chilli pickle sauce, add all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Set aside until required.

5. To fry the chicken, add oil to a deep pan and heat over a medium flame. Once it is hot, take the chicken out of the marination and first dredge in the flour. Dip the floured chicken in the egg mixture and then toss it in the breadcrumbs, ensuring that it is properly coated. Add the chicken to the oil, and fry over a medium flame till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper and let it rest for 5 minutes.

6. . To make the sandwiches, heat a pan over a medium flame, add some butter and toast the bread. Apply generous quantities of the chilli-pickle sauce on the toasted bread and arrange the fried chicken on one slice. Sprinkle garlic-coconut chutney over the chicken, top it with lemon-soaked onions and cucumbers and close the sandwich with another slice.
7. Cut the sandwich in half and enjoy.

title: Salami Roll Recipe
method: 1. Take wheat flour and all purpose flour in a vessel, add salt and knead soft dough and keep aside.
2. Put a little oil in the pan and lightly fry the salami slices.
3. Make parathas from the dough, cook it on the tawa and then spread mayonnaise on it.
4. After this, place salami slices on it and put tomato, onion and lettuce on it.
5. Sprinkle black pepper and salt on it, add green chutney and make a roll by placing it in foil. Enjoy it.

title: Chicken Bihari Boti Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Boneless chicken breast, cut into cubes

method: 1. Firstly, cut the onion in half, grate one half and finely slice the other half. Fry the sliced onions until golden brown and then remove and crush completely.
2. Now add both the fried/crushed onions and the grated onions along with all the other ingredients except the chicken pieces into a bowl and mix well. Then add the chicken pieces and mix to combine.
3. Cover and refrigerate overnight to marinate.
4. When ready to grill, thread the cubes onto skewers. Either grill over a charcoal BBQ until cooked through and tender or under a hot oven grill.
5. Make sure to turn the skewers often to get the chicken done on all sides. Brush them with some oil occasionally during grilling.
6. It should take about 5-6 minutes per side for them to be done. Serve with salad, fries, naan and parathas/chapatis or naans.

title: Mexican Chicken Nachos Recipe

ingredient.description: Kilograms Boneless and Skinless Chicken (Mix of breast and thigh meat)
(Cut into long thin slices like ¾ inch) Green pepper
(Cut into long thin slices like ¾ inch) Yellow pepper
(Cut into long thin slices like ¾ inch) Red pepper
or 3 (Cut into circular thin slices) Jalapenos
Mexican Cheese – More the better according to your love for cheese
and a half tsp Red Chilli Powder
tsp to 1 ½ tsp (According to your spice level) Black pepper powder

method: 1. Massage all the ingredients mentioned under marination list with the chicken.
2. Take 12 inches pan and put some oil and heat it up.
3. Add the marinated boneless chicken and cook it without closing the lid.
4. Let the juices from the chicken ooze out after 10 minutes of cooking and keep stirring the chicken occasionally so it doesn’t burn.
5. Chicken should be ready within 30 min.utes of cooking.
6. Taste the salt and add accordingly towards the end if needed
1. Take a square size aluminum pan as shown in the attached picture. Braise the pan with oil.
2. Put a layer of Tortilla chips. Top it with Onions, green peppers, red peppers, yellow peppers, black beans, cooked chicken and Jalapenos.
3. Add generous amount of Mexican Cheese.
4. Repeat the process of the above layering like 3 or 4 times based on the size of the pan and your available ingredients and cooked chicken.
1. Pre-heat the oven to 180 C. Put the square pan in the oven and bake it for 18 – 20 minutes and the final dish is ready !

title: Malai Tikka Pulao Recipe
method: 1. First of all, take boneless chicken in a bowl, add ginger garlic paste, green chili paste, salt, black pepper, cumin and coriander powder.
2. After this, add cream and curd, mix everything well and let the chicken marinate for 30 minutes.
3. Heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken pieces till they become light golden. Remember, the chicken is not to be cooked completely here.
4. Take 3 tbsp oil in a large kadhai or handi and fry all the whole spices in it on low flame, after 2 minutes fry the onion till golden.
5. Add chopped tomatoes and fry it and then add the remaining marination and cook it.
6. Add green chilies and fried chicken to it. Cook for some time.
7. Add garam masala and mint leaves and mix it and add water as required. Let it come to a boil and mix the pre-soaked rice in it.
8. When the rice is cooked to about 70 percent, place a hot coal inside a bowl in the middle of it, add this ghee and cover the handi with a lid and cook on low flame for at least 15 minutes.
9. After some time remove the coal bowl from the center and serve hot Malai Chicken Tikka Pulao by garnishing it with coriander leaves!

title: Ramadan Special Khichdi Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Chicken breast Organic hormone-free chicken

method: 1. Wash and clean chicken carefully and make them into small bite sizes pieces.
2. Marinate with half of the ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chilli powder & salt.
3. Keep the in the refrigerator (covered) for 45 mins.
4. Now take a pressure cooker and add ghee.
5. Followed by hing, bay leaves, pepper powder, dry red chillies, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, and mustard seeds, and let them crackle.
6. Add chopped onions, and green chillies, and cook for 5 minutes.
7. Then add ginger-garlic paste and saute till they are golden brown.
8. Now add chopped carrot and potatoes.
9. Cover and let it cook well.
10. Add the marinated chicken pieces and mix well so that all the pieces get coated.
11. Now add tomato and other dry ingredients along with salt.
12. Cover and let it cook until a fine aroma and a thick gravy is formed.
13. Now add the pre-soaked dal followed by rice.
14. Now add 2 cups of warm water mix well.
15. Cover with the lid and pressure cook for 3 to 4 whistles.
16. Once done serve hot with a dollop of ghee.

title: Butter Chicken Kulcha Recipe
method: 1. In a pan add roast onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic and some cashews. Once that is done, take it out and blend to make a sauce.
2. Pour this in a kadhai with some oil and let it come to a boil.
3. Throw in the chicken pieces in it with required spices. Once that is done, keep it aside.
4. Now, take a pan and add some butter on it.
5. Place a kulcha and put the chicken pieces on top of it.
6. Now place another kulcha from the top. Flip it and cook from the other side.
7. Before serving cut it in two equal parts and serve.

title: Chicken Potato Kebab Recipe
method: 1. First take a mixing bowl, add boiled potatoes, and mash them properly. Now add shredded boiled chicken along with garam masala, salt, roasted jeera powder, kaali mirch, ginger garlic paste, mint leaves, soya sauce and coriander leaves.
2. Once done mixing, add chopped green chillies and mash everything again. Refrigerate for 10-15 mins.
3. Now, take small portions from the mixture, roll it out and form a tikki like structure.
4. Dip the tikki into the beaten egg batter then coat it with breadcrumbs.
5. Repeat the same with remained kebab mixture.
6. Deep fry all the tikkis and your kebabs are ready
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Chicken Laccha Pakora Recipe

ingredient.description: gram Shredded potato or thin sliced potato

method: 1. Firstly, clean the boneless chicken pieces into small bite-sized cubes.
2. Now, marinate the chicken pieces with ingredients like gramflour (besan), refined flour, cornflour, red chilli powder, salt and black pepper.
3. Mix everything well and coat the chicken pieces properly. Set aside for some time.
4. To make the laccha, you need to peel a big sized potato, wash it and pat dry with your kitchen towel.
5. Add all the shredded potato into a bowl and add refined flour, red chilli powder, black pepper, garlic powder, salt. Mix well and set aside for around 10 mins for the potato to release water.
6. Heat oil in a large wok for deep frying till medium hot.
7. To make the pakoras, take a tablespoon of the potato mix on your palm. Place a piece of marinated chicken on top and then cover it with another tablespoon of potato mix.
8. Now, carefully drop the formed pakoras side by side in medium hot oil and do not stir for 1 min.
9. Now flip the pakoras and continue to fry these on medium heat for 8-9 mins. Fry and keep turning to give crisp and golden pakoras.
10. Remove from oil and continue to fry the rest in batches.
11. Serve and enjoy!

title: Summer Blossom Salad Recipe
method: 1. Mix all the ingredients together.
2. Add in the sweet honey dressing.
3. Serve and enjoy!!

title: Mexican Chicken Rice Recipe
method: 1. Heat a pan and add chicken pieces, let them cook.
2. Now, add chicken broth to it and throw in other vegetables like carrots, beans, corn with salsa, red chilli powder and some salt and pepper. Let it come to a boil.
3. Till then take another pan and add onions and garlic to it.
4. Add rice to it and roast it slightly.
5. Take this and mix it with broth. Let the rice cook.
6. Once it is done, garnish with cheese and enjoy!

title: Hyderabadi Green Chicken Recipe
method: 1. Now marinate this paste on the chicken pieces. In a pan add some oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger and garlic and mix.
2. Then add chopped onions to it. When the onions are done, then add the marinated chicken.
3. Let it cook for a while.
4. Now throw in garam masala, red chilli powder, salt, coriander powder and pepper. Combine it with some water and let it come to a boil.
5. Finally, garnish with coriander leaves and serve!

title: Gongura Chicken Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil and saute chopped onion until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and saute till oil leaves the sides of the pan.
2. Add tomato paste and gongura leaves paste and continue to saute in slow heat.
3. Add the boneless chicken and a little water. Cover with a lid and allow it to cook for 10 mins.
4. Remove the lid and add the powdered spices. Stir well and adjust salt. Keep aside.
1. Take 80% cooked basmati rice in a food pan.
2. Drizzle melted desi ghee, rose water, saffron water and kewra essence. Sprinkle the chopped coriander leaves, mint leaves and slit green chillies.
3. Finally add the sliced fried onion on top. Cover and cook in dum for 20 mins.
1. Now serve this in a bowl. Add the pre cooked gongura chicken on top or side of the rice.
2. Mix and enjoy!

title: Thai Chicken Fried Rice Recipe

ingredient.description: Red or green chile pepper, thinly sliced

method: 1. Firstly, add oil in the leftover rice to remove the lumps.
2. Take a large mixing bowl, add chopped chicken pieces along with 1 tbsp of soya sauce. Mix and keep aside.
3. Then take another bowl, add in fish sauce, chicken stock, soya sauce, lemon juice, sugar and pepper. Mix well.
4. Heat oil in a saucepan, add garlic, spring onions, chile and sautee well.
5. Then add the chicken. Stir-fry until 2 to 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and stir fry again for a minute or two.
6. Now, add rice and mix it well with the oil.
7. Now gradually start adding stir fry sauce 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time. Keep stirring until 7-8 mins. Add peas and mix again.
8. Break in the eggs and quickly stir-fry to scramble.
9. Continue stir-frying everything together over high heat until 2-3 mins.
10. Serve and enjoy!

title: Honey Garlic Chicken Recipe
method: 1. Cut the breasts in half horizontally to create 4 steaks in total. Sprinkle each side with salt and pepper.
2. Place flour in a shallow dish. Coat chicken in flour and shake off excess.
3. Melt most of the butter in a large skillet over high heat – hold back about 1 tsp for later.
4. Place chicken in skillet and cook for 2 – 3 minutes until golden. Turn and cook the other side for 1 minute.
5. Turn heat down slightly to medium high.
6. Make a bit of room in the pan and add garlic and top with remaining dab of butter. Stir garlic briefly once butter melts.
7. Add vinegar, soy sauce and honey. Stir / shake pan to combine. Bring sauce to simmer, then simmer for 1 minute or until slightly thickened.
8. Turn chicken to coat in sauce. If the sauce gets too thick, add a touch of water and stir.
9. Remove from stove immediately. Place chicken on plates and drizzle over remaining sauce.

title: Salt And Pepper Chicken Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Boneless chicken leg, cut into 1½ inch thin strips
and a half tsp Sesame Oil
2-3 Red bird eye chillies, finely chopped
cup Finely chopped mixed capsicum (red, green and yellow)
and a half tsp Sesame Oil
Chopped fresh spring onion greens for garnishing

method: 1. Put chicken strips in a bowl. Add salt and sesame oil.
2. Break egg yolk in a bowl. Add egg yolk and 1-2 teaspoons egg white to chicken mixture and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.
3. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
4. Add cornstarch and potato starch to marinated chicken strips and mix till well coated.
5. Put the chicken strips in hot oil and deep-fry till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
6. Put black peppercorn and sichuan peppercorns in a mortar and crush using a pestle into coarse powder.
7. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick wok. Add garlic and red bird eye chillies sauté for 1 minute.
8. Add onion and mixed capsicums and sauté for 1 minute. Add sugar, salt and sesame oil and mix well.
9. Drain the fried chicken strips into the sautéed onion mixture and mix. Add crushed peppercorn powder to taste and toss well.
10. Serve hot garnished with spring onion greens.

title: Kerala Chilli Mutton Recipe
method: 1. Add some coconut oil, chopped green chillies, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and mutton pieces in a cooker. Mix it well.
2. Once the mutton is cooked, take it off the heat; add some more oil in the same cooker.
3. Next, throw in chopped onions and spices like red chilli powder, pepper, coriander powder, salt as per taste, curry leaves and garam masala.
4. Combine and then add tomato puree. Let it cook for a while.
5. Next, add the cooked mutton and let it cook.
6. Once done, garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve!

title: Kerala-Style Chicken Curry Recipe
method: 1. Heat coconut oil in a pan. Add sliced onion and a pinch of salt, saute well.
2. Add chopped chilly and ginger garlic paste, saute for 2 mins. Add Kashmiri chilli powder, garam masala and turmeric powder.
3. Add chicken masala, saute for a minute. Then, add tomatoes and cook for a minute.
4. Add chicken pieces, mix well, close the pan and cook for 5 mins.
5. Pour 2 cups of water and cook till the meat gets cooked well. Then add pepper powder and mix well.
6. Sprinkle curry leaves and coriander leaves over the top of the gravy.
7. Chicken curry is ready.

title: Chicken Hakka Noodles Recipe
method: 1. Boil the chicken till it is tender.
2. Now heat oil in pan and cook pan fry the chicken pieces to give it a slightly crisp texture.
3. Once that is done, throw in veggies like onion, capsicum, carrots and more. Let it cook for a while.
4. Now add soy sauce, vinegar, pepper, salt and a bit of chilli flakes. Stir it well.
5. Next, throw in the boiled noodles and combine everything well.
6. Check the taste and adjust the spices as per your taste.
7. Once cooked, take it out in a bowl and garnish with spring onions before serving!

title: Afghani Momos Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in pan, deep fry or pan fry the momos until crispy.
2. Now the next step is to take a bowl, add in curd or cream along with all the spices.
3. Then, add fried momos along with a spoon of melted butter and momos chutney. Mix everything well.
4. Garnish with coriander leaves and your Afghani momos are ready!

title: Chicken Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Add the ingredients for the first marinade in a bowl and mix well.
2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 3-4 hours or overnight.
3. Add the ingredients for the second marinade in the bowl and mix well.
4. Keep the marinated chicken aside for 30 minutes.
5. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
6. Thread the marinated chicken in the skewers along with onion and capsicum.
7. Line the skewers on a foil lined baking tray.
8. Grill for 10-12 minutes and then rotate the skewers.
9. Grill for another 10-12 minutes.
10. Increase the oven temperature to 420 Degrees F and broil the skewers for 3-4 minutes until they are slightly charred.

title: Chicken Tikka Chaat Recipe
method: 1. Cut the chicken tikka into smaller pieces. Keep aside.
2. Take all the other ingredients in a bowl (except sev, anar dana and some coriander leaves).
3. Mix everything well. Add chicken tikka to it and mix.
4. Garnish with sev, pomegranate and coriander leaves and serve.

title: Creamy Mushroom Chicken Recipe

ingredient.description: Cup Mixture (half cup Milk + half cup Cream)

method: 1. Take chicken in mixing bowl with mixed herb, and lemon pepper, Olive Oil, Garlic Paste mix it well and keep it aside.
1. Heat olive oil in a wok, add garlic paste and saute it.
2. Then add finely chopped onion and saute it, till it becomes pink color.
3. Increase the flame and add button mushroom into it and saute it for some time.
4. Add mustard sauce and saute it. Now add milk and cream mixture, salt and mix it well. Cook this for 2-3 mins.
5. Finally add parmesan cheese and parsley, mix it well.
6. Once it is cooked, your mushroom sauce is ready.
1. Heat a grill pan and put marinated chicken pieces on it. Grill them properly for 3-4 mins.
1. Pour the mushroom sauce in serving platter and add grilled chicken pieces on it.
2. Sprinkle parmesan cheese and parsley on top.
3. Now the creamy mushroom chicken is ready to be served.

title: Mughlai Chicken Handi Recipe
method: 1. Start by heating ghee/oil in a handi or a large bottomed pan. Then add roughly chopped onion, fry until they turn golden and brown.
2. Once done, add in the ginger garlic paste and fry again for a few mins or until the raw smell disappears.
3. Now add in the chopped tomatoes, green chillies and continue frying until the tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
4. Then add the dry masalas- chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, salt and half of the crushed coriander seeds mix and stir fry for 2-3 mins.
5. Add in the chicken pieces and mix everything well with the masala.
6. Continue stirring for 3-4 mins. The chicken will slowly start releasing water. Now cover and cook the chicken for 15-20 minutes on medium heat.
7. When the chicken is almost cooked reduce the heat to low.
8. Add in the whisked hung curd, nut paste, sugar, kasoori methi and the rest of the coriander seeds and mix everything well.
9. Add garam masala powder and give it a good stir. Check the seasoning, add salt and sugar if required. Cook for another 8-10 minutes, stirring frequently.
10. Sprinkle some coriander leaves on the top and serve it hot with rice, roti or any bread of your choice.

title: Chicken Vegetable Soup Recipe
method: 1. Boil chicken with some salt till tender. Save the broth.
2. In a separate pan, boil the broth, add the vegetables, some salt, black pepper powder and oregano.
3. Boil till vegetables turn soft.
4. Add boiled shredded chicken, cook for a couple of minutes.
5. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.

title: Butter Chicken Recipe

ingredient.description: Kg boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-size chunks
1-2 tsp cayenne pepper, use to your taste kosher salt and black pepper
1-2 tsp crushed red pepper flakes, use to your taste
(14 ounce) can full-fat coconut milk (or sub 1 cup cream)

method: 1. In a bowl, toss together the chicken, yogurt, cloves garlic, ginger, garam masala, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and salt. Let sit 5-10 minutes.

2. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and sear on both sides until browned, about 2 minutes. Add butter and toss to coat the chicken. Remove the chicken from the skillet to a plate.

3. To the skillet, add the onion and cook 5 minutes, until softened. Add butter, cloves garlic, ginger, garam masala, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and the chili flakes. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until very fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and continue cooking another 3-4 minutes.

4. Reduce the heat to low. Add 1 cup water and the coconut milk. Stir to combine, bring the sauce to a simmer, cook 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Stir in butter. If the sauce seems thick, thin with 1/2 to 1 cup additional coconut milk. Add the chicken and any juices on the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper.
5. Butter chicken is ready! Serve it with naan or rice.

title: Goan Chicken Rava Fry Recipe
method: 1. Take a bowl and add yoghurt.
2. To this, add red chilli powder, pepper, salt, cardamom powder, ginger garlic paste, lemon and cloves. Mix it well.
3. Then take the chicken pieces and marinate them with the prepared paste for half an hour.
4. Then take semolina on a plate, coat the chicken pieces, and pan-fry it.
5. Once the chicken turns brown and crisp, garnish it with coriander leaves. Then it is ready to be served!

title: Whole Wheat Chicken Momo Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl add the meat, onions, ginger, coriander leaves, and butter and mix well.
2. Use your hands to properly rub all the ingredients together, add salt according to taste and let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
3. In the meanwhile, make a dough by mixing atta, a pinch of salt, oil, and water. Mix lightly hard dough and keep aside.
4. Make tiny balls out of the dough and roll out the tiny balls of dough in the size of a small poori.
5. Place a spoonful of filling in the middle and use a mold to shape the dumpling.
6. Or you can gather all the sides together and pinch it.
7. Grease the steaming plates with oil and let this steam for 20-30 minutes.
8. Check if the outer dough is cooked and serve hot.

title: Hyderabadi Chicken Curry Recipe
method: 1. Blend together, desiccated coconut, Peanuts and whole red chillies and keep blending until coarse powder.
2. Now, take a large vessel, heat oil and add cumins seeds. Wait for it to splutter.
3. Once done, add in chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes.
4. After onion turn slightly pink, add slit green chillies. Saute them for 2 more minutes and add curry leaves, cook again for a minute and add ginger garlic paste.
5. Now cook again on low-medium heat and add spices like turmeric powder, salt, red chilli powder, black pepper powder and coriander powder.
6. Give it a stir for a minute then add coarsely ground peanuts and coconut powder.
7. Cook all of these ingredients together on low heat for a minute and add few tablespoon of water to make the masala thick.
8. Add chicken pieces and coat them evenly with masala. Now, add tamarind paste and garam masala powder.
9. Add water, cover it up and let it cook for 5 minutes.
10. Open the lid, give it a good stir and cook again for 10 minutes.
11. Your chicken curry is ready to be served!

title: Allam Kodi Wings Roast Recipe
method: 1. Wash and clean the chicken thoroughly and drain all the water.

2. In a mixing bowl, add chicken wings, two tablespoons of chilli powder, 3 chillies finely chopped, 1/2 tablespoon of turmeric powder, 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste, 1 tablespoon garam masala, and 1 tablespoon of oil, and add salt to taste. Let it sit for 10 minutes.
3. Place the marinated chicken wings on the skewers and place them in the coal-fired tandoor oven to cook for 10 minutes

4. Add 10 ml oil to the frying pan and add chopped onion (80 gm), chopped garlic (30 gm), chopped ginger (50gm), curry leaf, ginger paste & add the chicken wings. Sauté the chicken wings until they form a roast.
5. Add chopped coriander leaves and cut off the flame.
6. Transfer the smoky Allam Kodi wings roast to the serving plate, garnish with finely chopped onion salad.

title: Butter Chicken Momos Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half cup All Purpose Flour

method: 1. Knead a dough by using all-purpose flour, keep it aside.
2. Meanwhile, prepare chicken filling for the momos. Mince the chicken and add in seasonings like salt, blackpapper and ginger garlic paste.
3. Once done, take a tiny portion from the dough, roll it out and fill it with prepared minced chicken.
4. Apply water on the edges and bring the sides together to shape them like momos. Steam the momos for 10-12 mins.
5. Heat oil in a pan, add the momos and pan fry them for about a minute.
6. Once done, add in butter chicken gravy and mix everything well.
7. Garnish with kasuri methi and cream.
8. Your butter chicken momos are ready to be savoured!

title: Jungli Pulao Recipe

ingredient.description: A handful of coriander leaves chopped

method: 1. In a small bowl, mix cumin powder, red chili powder, and haldi powder with some water to make a semi-liquid slurry.
2. Wash and soak rice until the next step. In a pan, heat some oil and add the whole spices. Let this splutter and then add chopped onions and fry until slightly golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone. Add tomatoes and mix until mushy.
4. Add masala slurry to this and cook for some time. Now add the chicken and some water and let this cook until the chicken is almost done.
5. Now add the rice, vegetables and mix everything well.
6. Add 2-3 cups of water or enough to cook the rice. Let this simmer on low flame for around 20-30 mins until the water has dried and the rice is cooked.
7. Take off the heat and let it sit for some time. Drizzle spoonful of ghee and coriander leaves right before serving. Enjoy hot.

title: Kerala-Style Chilli Chicken Recipe
method: 1. Cut the chicken into small cubed sized pieces and wash with little turmeric powder; drain it and set it aside.
2. Meanwhile, heat a pan and dry roast the dry spices. Once done, grind the above roasted spices into a coarse powder.
3. Marinate the chicken pieces with roasted powder, chilli flakes, ginger garlic paste, curry leaves, vinegar or lemon juice, salt to taste.
4. Heat the pan with 3 tbsp of oil and fry the coconut slices to light brown colour.
5. In the same pan, add the remaining oil and add finely chopped onions and green chilies and saute until translucent and brown in colour, now add the curry leaves and saute for couple of minutes.
6. Now add marinated chicken pieces and combine well; fry it for 5-10 mins, cover and cook till the chicken well cooked.

7. Add the tomato puree and roast it over medium-low flame till the pure changes colour. Once the chicken starts to dry and have attained the dark brown color then add fried coconut slices and combine well.
8. Your chicken is ready to be savoured.

title: Butter Chicken Sandwich Spread Recipe
method: 1. Marinate the chicken chunks with little haldi, red chili powder and salt for 10 minutes. Fry and keep aside after that.
2. In a pan add a mix of little oil and half the butter, add onion paste and cook it until translucent.
3. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
4. Add tomato puree and cook until the tomato puree changes colour.
5. Add dried spices like haldi, red chilli powder, garam masala and the remaining butter.
6. Cook for some time, add cashew paste, salt and cream too.
7. Now add the chicken chunks and simmer for 5 minutes more.
8. The butter chicken is cooked, now take off the heat and let it completely cool down.
9. Add mayonnaise and mix well until mayo and chicken gravy is well incorporated.
10. Store in a glass airtight container and consume within 7-10 days.

title: Chicken Kofta Curry Recipe
method: 1. In a mixing bowl, add chicken mince, onions, green chillies, garlic and coriander leaves. Mix it well, and make balls of the mixture. Keep it in the refrigerator.
2. Next, fry onions and grind them into a paste with curd.
3. Heat oil in a pan, add the whole spices and ginger-garlic paste. Once the raw smell is gone, add the brown paste and tomato puree. Add all the spice powders except garam masala.
4. Fry on low heat with a splash of water for 2-3 mins till oil separates.
5. Add water and garam masala. Slide in the meatballs and cover pan. Let the kofta cook for 20-25 minutes.

title: Tandoori Chicken Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, add four-five chicken pieces. Marinate it with curd, red chilli powder pepper, chaat masala, garam masala, salt and ginger garlic paste.
2. Once done, let it rest for a while. Then bake it in an oven or pan. Once it is charred, take it out.
3. Then take two slices of bread, add a layer of barbecue sauce.
4. Then add a piece of cheese, tandoori chicken, onions, tomatoes, and capsicum.
5. Finally, add hot sauce, mustard sauce or any other sauce of your choice.
6. Close it from the top, cut and serve to enjoy!

title: Zafrani Chicken Korma Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tbsp Cashew Paste

method: 1. Firstly, heat ghee in a large vessel. Add the whole spices, fry for a while then add the chicken pieces and fry for a few minutes.
2. In a separate container, combine onion paste, fried onion, ginger paste, garlic paste, nut paste, poppy seed powder, and salt together. Then, add this mixture to the chicken and cook.
3. Cook very well adding small quantity of water little by little
4. Once the spices are well cooked, add water enough to make the chicken tender but remember don't add too much water.
5. Wait until water evaporates then add the cream and milk . Don’t cover with lid. Wait for 5-6 minutes and then add hand full of whole green chilies .
6. Add white pepper ,nutmeg and mace powder and little sugar. Add the saffron soaked milk. Sprinkle some keora water and turn off the heat.
7. Keep the pot on the stove with lid on until you serve to retain the essence.

title: Chicken Spring Roll Recipe
method: 1. Add some oil, shredded chicken pieces in a pan, and cook it. Then take out the chicken.
2. Add chopped ginger-garlic, onion, capsicum, and cabbage in the same pan. Mix it well.
3. Throw in the cooked chicken pieces and add red chilli powder, salt, pepper, and mix.
4. Once it is cooked, keep it aside.
5. For preparing the sheet, add all-purpose flour, cornflour, salt, and water in a bowl.
6. Make a runny batter. Then, heat a pan, and pour a ladle full of it.
7. Spread evenly and cook slightly. Repeat to make the spring roll sheets.
8. Once they are ready, add in the filling, roll it and fry till a crisp!
9. Take out fresh spring rolls and enjoy!

title: Chicken Loaded Nachos Recipe
method: 1. To quickly cook some nachos, you can take the leftover rotis and bake them until crisp.
2. Now in a pan, add some oil and mix in shredded chicken.
3. Then add spices like red chilli powder, salt and pepper. Let it cook.
4. Once it cooks, turn off the gas. Until then, finely chop onions, tomatoes, corn and capsicum.
5. Toss these veggies in peri-peri masala.
6. In a bowl, add the prepared nachos, put in the prepared chicken and top it with veggies.
7. Then add some hot sauce and cheese sauce to complete it! Once done, serve and enjoy!

title: Chicken Garlic Bread Recipe

ingredient.description: A large pinch of crushed black peppercorns
tsp dried red chilli flakes + for sprinkling

method: 1. Preheat the oven at 180˚C.
2. Take butter in a bowl, add garlic, parsley, crushed black peppercorns, dried red chilli flakes, salt and chicken and mix well.
3. Arrange bread slices on a baking tray and place a portion of chicken mixture on each slice.
4. Keep the baking tray in the oven and bake for 6-8 minutes. Bring the tray out of the oven and arrange the bread slices on a serving plate.
5. Sprinkle dried red chilli flakes and garnish with fresh parsley sprigs. Serve hot.

title: Kashmiri Yakhni Pulao Recipe
method: 1. Combine all the whole spices and wrap in a muslin cloth. Tie it from all ends to make a polti (bag).
2. Boil chicken pieces in water along with the spice potli.
3. Remove the poti and keep the stock. This is called yakhni.
4. Heat ghee in a pan. Roast the rest of the spices for a minute. Add yakhni (chicken stock).
5. Add rice and cook till rice is done. Top with fried onion slices.

title: Andhra Style Chicken Fry Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, you need to marinate the chicken with salt, red chili powder, ginger and garlic paste, turmeric and curd and keep aside for an hour.
2. Now, slice onions. Also, chop the coriander leaves and squeeze lemon juice in a separate bowl. Then crush the cashews into powdered form and keep aside.
3. Once the chicken is marinated, heat ghee in a large wok, cook onions on low flame till the onion turns translucent.
4. Now, add marinated chicken in the wok and cook until the chicken turns tender and juicy.
5. Meanwhile, heat oil in an other pan, heat oil and sautee green chillies and curry leaves.
6. Now, add this tadka to the chicken wok along with powdered cashews, black pepper, salt, red chilli and salt to taste.
7. Now fry the chicken for sometime. Keep stirring for about 5 minutes. At last, add chopped coriander leaves and lemon juice.
8. Serve hot with roti or naan and rice.

title: Chicken Masala Omelette Recipe
method: 1. Whisk the eggs until the yolks and whites are completely combined.
2. Once done, add seasonings like salt, red chilli powder, black pepper and coriander powder. Mix well.
3. Now, heat oil in a pan, add tiny chunks and stir fry for about 2-3 minutes.
4. Once done, in the pan, add oil (if required), pour the egg mixture, cook a little and then add the chicken chunks.
5. Season it with mixed herbs and you can also add grated cheese. Cook from both sides.
6. Serve with toasted breads and enjoy the wholesome breakfast meal.

title: Hariyali Chicken Biryani Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half cups Soaked Basmati rice

method: 1. For Green Paste: Grind all the ingredients like cumin seeds, pepper corns, green chillies, ginger garlic, blanched spinach, coriander and mint leaves, lemon juice, together in a grinder until a smooth paste. Add a little amount of water.
2. For Marination: Then, marinate the chicken pieces with the salt, biryani masala, chilli powder and fried onions. Add half of the green paste and marinate for at least for 2 hours.
3. In a heavy bottom pan, add the ghee and chicken pieces. Cook the chicken until the chicken turns brown. Once brown add the rest of the green ground masala cover and cook for 10-12 mins.
4. Now, add a piece of burnt coal inside a piece of foil and drizzle some ghee or oil on it and cover the pan with the lid for a few minutes so the gravy has a smoky flavour.
5. Add yogurt, mix it and turn off the heat.
6. In another steel bowl, add water along with the whole spices, green chillies, and salt and allow it to boil.
7. Add the rice and cook till 70% done. Drain the excess water and pour the rice over the chicken gravy.
8. Add the fried onions, saffron milk, boiled eggs (optional), tomato slices (4-5) and roasted cashew nuts over the top.
9. Cover with a heavy lid and allow this to steam for about half an hour.
10. Serve and enjoy!

title: Aloo Chicken Curry Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tbsp Red Chilli Powder

method: 1. Heat oil in a kadhai. Add the whole spices - cinnamon, green cardamom, pepper corn, bay leaf and cumin seeds.
2. Once the cumin seeds start to splutter add the onions. Saute them till they are golden brown and crips. Add salt to fasten the onions cooking process.
3. Now add the chicken and sear it. Next add the potatoes. Fry the chicken and potatoes till they are golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes and mix well. Pour in the whisked yoghurt.

4. Once the oil separates, add turmeric powder, chilli powder, pepper powder, slit green chillies, garam masala powder and mix well. Pour in water to make the gravy. Let the gravy cook till the chicken is done.
5. The chicken potato curry is ready to be serve!

title: Yakhni Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil/ghee in a pan and add onion slices. Then, add whole spices and fry it for a minute on medium-low flame.

2. Then, add chicken pieces and stir until it changes its colour. Now add ginger garlic paste, dry masalas (mentioned in ingredients list), yogurt, tomato puree, mix them well and stir constantly till oil separates.
3. Add 1 cup water bring to boil now cover the lid and allow to cook it on medium-low flame for about 30 minutes.
4. Now add drained rice and green chilies stir it and taste the salt at this stage you can adjust it. (add water if required).
5. Cover the lid and let it cook for 5-8 minutes on the high-medium flame.
6. After 5-6 minutes remove the lid and sprinkle some drops of food color and biryani essence (optional). Simmer it for 10 minutes.
7. Serve with salan and raita and enjoy!

title: Andhra Style Chicken Kadhi Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil (coconut oil, preferably) in a pan, add chicken along with ginger garlic paste, curry leaves and dry masalas.
2. Then add water and close the lid and cook until water evaporates.
3. In another bowl, add besan (gram flour), water and mix it well. Now add curd, salt (to taste) and mix again.
4. Add oil in another pan, fry onion slices, turmeric and green chilies for 2 mins.
5. Add curd mixture and let it boil for 2 mins.
6. Once done, add chicken pieces and cook for another 10 mins.
7. Serve and enjoy!

title: Chicken Majestic Recipe
method: 1. Soak chicken in buttermilk for 4 hours. Drain the chicken and marinate it in ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, corn flour and red chilli powder.
2. Deep fry the chicken till it is golden brown. You can also pan fry the chicken if you like. Keep it aside.
3. Now for the masala, place a wok on heat. Saute curry leaves and green chillies in oil. Fry till the curry leaves are crispy and the garlic cooked.
4. Next add mint leaves, red chilli powder and garam masala, mix it well. Pour in the yoghurt, stir till the moisture is evaporated. Add soya sauce and the fried chicken. Mix it well, and serve!

title: Honey Chicken Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, take boneless chicken pieces and fry them for 4-5 minutes on medium flame. Once done, keep them aside.
2. Then place a pan on medium flame, add butter and honey onto it. Once the butter is melted, turn off the flame.
3. Now add lemon juice, ginger garlic paste and salt in the same pan and mix everything well.
4. Add the chicken pieces into this honey mixture and cook for about 10 minutes on low-medium flame. Ps: If you want a fiery texture, you can also use schezwan sauce.
5. Your honey chicken recipe is ready to be savoured.

title: One Pot Chicken Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Marinate the chicken in curd, coriander leaves, turmeric powder, cumin powder, pepper powder and salt.
2. Let it marinate for 30 minutes.
3. Place a pressure cooker on low flame, add cumin seeds, bay leaves, cinnamon, anise, cardamom, cloves, ginger-garlic and chopped onions.
4. Once the onion lose colour, add the marinated chicken and mix well. Let it cook slowly for 10 minutes.
5. Next, add tomatoes, green chillies and stir. Once the tomatoes are mushy, add red chilli powder, garam masala powder, coriander powder, black pepper.
6. Add the soaked rice in the pressure cooker and pour in water. Till now the chicken would be semi-cooked the rest of the cooking will happen with the rice.
7. Seal the pressure cooker and let the biryani cook for 2 whistles. Release the pressure and the biryani is ready!

title: Jhol Momos Recipe
method: 1. To make the momos, take minced meat and season it masalas and garlic.
2. Then prepare a dough from all-purpose flour, salt and oil for the momos.
3. Roll out this dough, add in the filling and steam the momos.
4. Now for the jhol, take tomato pure and cook it.
5. Then add red chilli, salt, pepper, turmeric and ginger. Then once it starts to thicken add water and let is boil.
6. Pour this jhol in a bowl and add in the momos from top! Jhol momos are ready to eat!

title: Malabar Chicken Curry Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped and sliced onions and fry until slightly brown. Keep stirring while frying. Once done, add curry leaves, green chillies followed by ginger-garlic paste. Fry again.
2. The next step is to add coriander powder, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, black pepper powder and mix everything well. Keep stirring for 2-3 minutes.
3. After that add chopped tomatoes, salt to taste, cover and cook again for 3-4 minutes or until tomatoes turn mushy.

4. Once done, add chicken, mix and cook on high heat for 5 minutes. Then add fresh coconut paste and water (To make coconut paste, add coconut and water in a blender and blend until smooth and consistent paste). Cover and cook for 5 minutes.

1. heat coconut oil in another pan, add mustard seeds, green chillies and let them splutter for 5-6 seconds. Then add chopped coconut (fresh) along with shallots. Fry on medium heat until the onion turns slightly brown.
2. Pour the chicken tadka on the chicken curry and your delish is ready to relish.
3. Serve with parotta, steamed rice and even tandoori paratha along with lime quarters and of course onion rings.

title: Chicken Burnt Garlic Fried Rice Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped garlic to it. Sauté for 1 minute or until brown.
2. Once done, add onions and fry until translucent. After that add chopped chicken chunks and let them cook for 3-4 minutes.
3. Once the chicken is cooked, add salt, green chillies, pepper, soya sauce and vinegar.
4. Mix everything well and keep stirring for a minute. Now, add rice and mix everything well again.
5. Now, in another pan, heat olive oil and add sliced garlic, cook until golden brown.
6. Pour it over the rice and your delish is ready to relish.

title: Kolkata-Style Chicken Chaap Recipe
method: 1. Take a large mixing bowl, add hung curd, onion paste, ginger garlic paste, besan, (for crunch), red chilli powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala paste and other dry spices and dry fruits and nuts like cashew nuts paste, poppy seeds, kewra water, saffron etc.
2. Now, take large bottomed pan and add 3 tbsp of ghee and 3 tbsp of oil. Then add, cumin seeds, caraway seeds and let them splutter.
3. Once done, add the marinated chicken followed by all the masala and slow cook it on low to medium heat.
4. Continue stirring to avoid burn and stickiness at the bottom of the pan.
5. Saute for 10-15 minutes or until the curry is all dried up.
6. Serve hot with pulao, naan or roomali roti and enjoy!

title: Tariwala Chicken Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half Finely chopped onion

method: 1. First marinate the chicken with curd, spices and ginger garlic paste and set it aside for 30 minutes.
2. Then in a pan add onions and fry them till they are crispy and brown. Once it’s done take it out and add the chicken to fry it.
3. When the chicken starts frying add all the masalas and ginger garlic paste. Mix these well till all the flavours combine and add some water.
4. Let it cook for 5 minutes on medium flame. Then add curd and cook till the oil starts separating.
5. Till it cooks, blend your fried onions with hard spices and throw in the chicken. Mix and cook for additional 5-6 minutes.
6. Serve and enjoy.

title: BBQ Chicken Biryani Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of Yellow food color

method: 1. Create a marinade using the ingredients mentioned above. Add chicken to the marinade and mix well. Let the chicken marinate for 30 minutes.

2. Heat oil in a pan and cook the marinated chicken. Once it is cooked, place hot coal in the middle and cover the chicken. The coal will smoke in the flavour barbecue flavour in the cooked chicken. Once done, set it aside.
3. Take a biryani cooking dish, Add oil, onion, bay leaves and cardamom. Saute for 2 minutes.
4. Add chillies, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chilli powder and garam masala.
5. Cook for a while. Then add yoghurt. Mix well. Add the cooked chicken and mix well. Finally, add coriander and mint leaves.
6. Mix in yellow food colour to yoghurt, pour in the biryani masala. Mix the masala well. .
7. Place cooked rice on top of the biryani masala. Garnish the rice with onions. Cover the dish and let it steam for 30 minutes.
8. Serve with mirchi ka salan, mint chutney, onion rings and your one-pot meal is ready to relish!

title: Degi Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Rinse and soak the rice for about 30 minutes.
2. Once done, add all the whole spices and give it a good boil until the rice gets 80% cooked.
3. After this, drain the rice and set it aside.
1. Heat ghee in a large vessel and add all the whole spices again followed by green chillies and ginger garlic paste. Stir fry for about 5-6 minutes.
2. Then add dum biryani powder or any biryani powder and stir again for 5 minutes.
3. Now, add chicken pieces and mix everything well.
4. Once chicken turns tender, add curd and mix again.
5. Now pour the cooked rice on top of the chicken gravy and add chilli pickle deep in between the rice.
6. Cover the pan with an aluminium foil and cook for 6-7 minutes.
7. Pour a generous amount of ghee on top and cover for 10 minutes.
8. Garnish with fried onions, coriander leaves and mint leaves and enjoy!

title: Chicken Shahjahani Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl of warm water soak poppy seeds, muskmelon seeds and cashews for 10-15 minutes. After which make a paste out of them.
2. In a pan add the ghee and oil, add all the whole spices and onions and fry until onions are translucent.
3. Remove from heat and let this cook before making a fine paste out of this as well.
4. Now in the same pan, add ginger garlic paste and let it cook until the raw smell is gone.
5. Now add the paste made out of seeds and onion paste to this. Make sure to keep stirring to save the masala from burning.
6. Now add red chilly powder, haldi, salt and mix well. Add some water if required.
7. Add the chicken and let that cook for 5 mins.
8. Now add curd and some water and cook for another 5 minutes.
9. Sprinkle some kewda water (Optional) and garam masala and cook for another 10 mins.
10. Serve with rice and enjoy!

title: Butter Chicken Meat Balls Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tbsp Cumin powder

method: 1. In a medium bowl, stir together bread crumbs and milk. Add in garlic, egg, salt, and pepper, mix well. Stir in chicken keema. Combine well, but do not overmix. Roll the meat into balls.
2. Pour 1 tablespoon oil into a skillet over medium heat. Add meatballs and brown on all sides. Remove meatballs from the pan (meatballs will not be fully cooked through at this time).
3. For the gravy, heat oil and butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger, then let sizzle for a minute or two.
4. Stir in cumin powder, paprika, garam masala, cayenne, and salt. Let spices heat through until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes and bring sauce to a simmer, then take off the heat.
5. Let the sauce cool for 5–10 minutes. Blend sauce until smooth.
6. Pour the sauce back into the skillet. Whisk in the butter and cream. Add the meatballs to the sauce and stir to coat. Cover and cook for 5 minutes, or until meatballs are fully cooked through.
7. Serve hot with your choice of naan!

title: Chicken Parantha Recipe

ingredient.description: 1-2 tbsp Oil to cook the marinated chicken

method: 1. Cut the chicken into small pieces, marinate the chicken in all the spices and ingredients for 30 minutes.
2. Cook the marinated chicken. Then, shred the cooked chicken and let it cool done. Add the chopped onions, chilli and coriander to the shredded chicken. Your chicken stuffing is ready.
3. In another bowl, sieve together wheat flour and refined flour. Add salt and water as required. Kneed your dough till it forms a ball shape. Apply oil on the dough ball and let it rest for 15 min.

4. Divide the dough into equal but smaller balls. Roll two dough balls into a round parantha, add the chicken stuffing on one of the raw paranthas. Place the other raw parantha on top of it and seal the chicken stuffing inside.
5. Cook the stuffed parantha on a tawa till they are golden. Chicken parantha is ready!

title: Chicken Pinwheel sandwich Recipe
method: 1. In a frying pan, heat oil. Add minced chicken, salt, black pepper and cook. Keep aside to cool down.
2. Prepare the green chutney, grind coriander, green chillies, yogurt, garlic and ginger in a mixer.
3. Add the chutney to the chicken and mash.
4. Cut the crust from the bread slices. Flatten each slice with rolling pin. We need 2 slices per roll.
5. Join 2 slices using water as an adhesive. On 1st slice spread the chicken mix and onions. On 2nd slice, spread cheese. Roll tightly.
6. Set in fridge for an hour. Cut into pieces and serve.

title: Herbs and Paprika Chicken Breast Recipe
method: 1. Firstly, thaw the chicken breast in lukewarm water.
2. Pan sear it for two minutes and dice it into thin slices.
3. Now grab a few tortillas and place the diced slices into them, evenly. or you can enjoy it as a standalone recipe too. The choice is yours!
4. Finish off the dish by garnishing with cheese, mayo and any veggies of your choice. Your delicious meal is ready to eat!

title: Chicken Sub Sandwich Recipe
method: 1. Slice the bread into half, keep aside. Tear the lettuce leaves using your hands and keep aside.
2. Place the following on one half of the bread according to the given order: cheese slice, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, onion and chicken pieces.
3. Drizzle with mustard, mint mayo and sweet chilli sauce. Place the other half of the bread on top.
4. The sub sandwich is ready! You can little toast it in the oven if you want a crispy bread layer.

title: Chicken Tagine With Olives And Preserved Lemons Recipe

ingredient.description: pcs Kalamata olives, pitted and halved
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

method: 1. Mix garlic, saffron, ginger, paprika, cumin and turmeric together. If not using kosher chicken, add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add pepper to taste. Rub chicken with mixture, cover, refrigerate and marinate 3 to 4 hours.
2. Heat oil in heavy skillet. Add chicken, and brown on all sides. Remove to platter. Add onions to skillet, and cook over medium-low heat about 15 minutes, until lightly browned.
3. Transfer to tagine, if you are using one, or leave in skillet. Add cinnamon stick.

4. Put chicken on onions and scatter with olives. Quarter the lemons, remove pulp and cut skin into strips. Then, scatter it over the chicken. Mix stock along with lemon juice and pour it over chicken.
5. Cover tagine or skillet. Place over low heat, and cook about 30 minutes, until chicken is done. Scatter parsley on top, and serve.

title: Chole chicken Recipe
method: 1. Soak chole overnight and pressure cook until soft with cardamom, cinnamon and cloves and bay leaf.
2. In a pan heat ghee and fry the chicken for 5-8 mins. Take it out and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, add whole spices and sliced onions and fry until pinkish brown. To this add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone
4. Add tomato puree, red chilli powder, haldi, and salt as required. Let this cook until the masala leaves some oil.
5. Now add the fried chicken, Mix and cook for a while.
6. Add cooked chole, slit chilli and pomegranate. Cover and cook for 15-20 mins or until properly cooked.
7. After taking off lid add garam masala and coriander and let that mix for 2 mins.
8. Your Chole chicken is ready, serve hot with paratha, tandoori roti or rice.

title: Chicken Salna Recipe
method: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add coconut, peanuts along with dry ingredients like fennel seeds, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon and pepper corn.
2. Roast all the spices on low flame for 2-3 minutes. Once done, blend them in a blender by adding water as required to make a consistent paste. (when cool down).
3. Now heat oil in another pan again, add sliced onions, curry leaves along with ginger garlic paste and salt to taste.
4. Saute for few minutes until onions get transculent and soft.
5. Now, add in chopped tomatoes and cover the lid until tomatoes get soft and juiced down.
6. Add curry powder (optional) along with red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and salt to taste.
7. Then add chicken pieces and mix everything so well.
8. Add water and cover the lid for 15-20 minutes and keep stirring meanwhile to avoid burning.
9. Add coriander leaves and mint leaves to garnish.
10. Serve it hot with parotta, rice or idli.

title: Chicken Bukhara Recipe
method: 1. In a bowl, marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste, half of your hung curd, tandoori masala, salt and corn flour. Let it marinate for minimum 30 mins but it would be ideal to let it sit for 2 hours.
2. While the chicken is marinating, let us make the gravy. In a pan heat oil and add chopped onions, fry them carefully and don’t let them brown.
3. After 2 mins, add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
4. Now add your salt, haldi, red chilli powder, Kashmiri chilli powder, black pepper and let these cook.
5. After a while, add the tomato puree and let it cook until the oil sticks to the surface.
6. Now add your remaining curd, almond-cashew puree and star ingredient, Aloo Bukhara.
7. Let this cook properly, till then in another pan fry the chicken in medium heat.
8. Now add the fried chicken and 1 cup of water, with the lid on let it cook for another 10 mins or till the time you feel the chicken is cooked.
9. In the end, sprinkle some kasuri methi and garam masala, cook for 2 mins and serve warm with roti, rice or however you like it.

title: Sofiana Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Wash the chicken in a bowl properly. Then add curd, ginger garlic paste and set aside for atleast 3-4 hours or overnight for best results.
1. Take basmati rice in a bowl and wash it thoroughly. Then soak it for 15 minutes.
2. In a wide and heavy vessel, add 4-5 cups of water and add rice along with whole spices and salt. Cook until half-cooked.
3. Drain the water and spread the rice on a plate or a tray. keep it aside for sometime.
4. Meanwhile, soak saffron in warm milk for 10-15 minutes.
1. Heat oil in a pan, add sliced onion and wait until they get brown and crispy. Take it out and keep aside.
2. Take another pan and add oil along with ghee and then add bay leaves, mice, cinnamon stick, cardamom, black cardamom and let it splutter and fragrant.
3. Add the finely chopped onion and sauté it over a medium flame. (Do not allow it to get brown) Wait until it gets translucent.
4. Add the remaining ginger and garlic paste and keep sautéing for 5 mins. Again, cook on a medium flame.
5. Now add chicken along with salt as required and give it a good stir. Cover it for 2-3 minutes and open the lid to give a good stir again.
6. Meanwhile, make a paste of soaked almonds by removing the skin of almonds and blending it in the blender.
7. Now in a blender, place the heavy cream, khoya and almond paste that you made earlier together. Blend together to make a thick paste.
8. Keep stirring on medium flame and keep the pan covered so that the chicken gets cooked in it’s own juices.
9. Now add grinded paste of nutmeg and mace and set aside.
1. Add rice on the top of the chicken gravy and add 2 tablespoon of ghee.
2. Garnish it with fried onions, mint leaves, sliced almonds, green chillies, saffron soaked milk and 1 tsp of rose water (optional).
3. Cover it again with a heavy lid for 10-15 minutes so that the biryani gets the actual flavour of all the ingredients.
4. Place boiled eggs and serve with raita, mint chutney and onion rings or spicy mutton gravy!

title: Nadan Kozhi Curry Recipe
method: 1. Grind ginger garlic paste, green chilies and curry leaves along with onion in the blender. Do not completely blend it.
2. Heat oil in a kadhai and add the blended mixture with salt, saute well until golden brown. It will take at least 20-25 minutes approximately.
3. Add turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala powder and coriander powder. Saute for about 5 – 6 minutes or until their raw smell leaves.
4. Add chopped tomato pieces. Saute really well until tomato gets mashed up completely and oil separates.
5. Add 1/4 cup hot water. Mix well. Add the chicken pieces, salt as required and mix everything well so that the chicken gets well-coated with the gravy.
6. Cover it until the chicken pieces get tender.
7. Now in a separate pan, add coconut oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves and let them splutter. Pour this on the top of the curry and cover it for 10 minutes.
8. Serve with your favourite bread or rice. Enjoy!

title: Butter Chicken Noodles Recipe
method: 1. Boil tomatoes, onion, garlic, cardamom, black cardamom, whole red chillies, clove, cinnamon stick, cashews and butter in a bowl until tomatoes are soft.
2. Grind and strain. Now add butter in a pan and pour the strained mixture into the pan. Stir for 10 minutes.
3. Add salt, sugar, methi and cream. Mix well.
4. Then add noodles and shredded chicken. Mix properly and serve.

title: Kadai Chicken Kebab Curry Recipe
method: 1. Combine minced chicken with salt, red chilli powder, half tbsp ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice and turmeric powder. Let the mixture rest for about one hour.
2. Add some rice flour and make kebabs. Fry them in hot oil. Keep aside.
3. Saute onion in a pan till cooked, add half tbsp ginger-garlic paste.
4. Grind coriander seeds, whole red chillies and cumin seeds. Add the powder along with salt and saute well.
5. Add curd and cook for 2 minutes. Add some water and boil for 5 minutes.
6. Add kasuri methi and garam masala powder. Toss in the kebabs. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

title: Butter Chicken Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Marinate the chicken with ginger garlic paste, garam masala, tandoori masala, curd, red chilli powder, salt, oil, lemon juice and cumin powder. Keep it aside for 3-4 hours.
2. Heat butter in a pan and fry the chicken pieces for about 5 minutes.
3. In a container, add all the chicken pieces and burnt coal in between the chicken pieces and cover the container.
4. Now in a separate pan, add oil and onion. Fry until golden brown. Keep some amount of onions aside as it will be used as garnishing in the end.
5. Blend cashews, tomatoes and fried onions.
6. In the same oil pan, add whole garam masala, including bay leaf, cardamom, cinnamon stick, cloves and peppercorn. Let splutter.
7. Add ginger garlic paste and fry until raw smell disappears. Then add this cashew paste and fry until oil separates.
8. Now add salt , red chilly powder , coriander powder and roast for a minute.
9. Add 1/2 cup water and fry until oil separates. Now add curd and marinade ( the preserved gravy ) and fry for sometime.
10. Lastly add cumin powder , garam masala powder and sugar .Cook for 5 minutes and adjust salt and red chilly powder.
11. Add milk , cream , mix well and cook on low flame for 2-3 minutes.
12. Now add chicken tikkas and mix well , cook for 7 – 10 minutes , adjust the gravy and off the gas.
13. Garnish with coriander leaves and here your butter chicken is ready to assemble into Butter chicken biryani.
14. Now for rice, Soak rice for 30-40 minutes. Side by side as the gravy is being prepared , in a large deep pan or pot , boil water with salt .
15. Add whole garam masala in the boiling water and add soaked rice. Cook until the rice is 3/4th done. Roughly hand pick the whole garam masala and discard them .

16. To assemble chicken biryani, Add the boiled rice on the top of the Butter chicken gravy. Add ghee, roasted cashews and sprinkle some coriander leaves and fried onions. Cover the pan for 20 minutes.
17. Serve hot with a delicious bowl of raita.

title: Kadaknath Chicken Curry Recipe
method: 1. Heat a pan and add oil, mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds.
2. When mustard splutters, add curry leaves, chopped onions, salt, turmeric and fry for a few minutes.
3. When onion turns slightly brown, add ginger-garlic paste and salt, fry for a few seconds (until the raw smell is gone).
4. Add kadaknath chicken and half a cup of water. Cook the chicken until done, it would take about 12-15 minutes approximately. Add tomatoes once the chicken is cooked.
5. Add 3 teaspoons of Daily Samayal's special karimasala Podi powder and tomato puree.
6. Add ground coconut paste to this mixture and allow it cook for another 5-8 minutes.
7. Allow it to stand for a few minutes and then serve with hot rice or chapatis.

title: Mangalore Chicken Ghee Roast Recipe
method: 1. Wash and clean the chicken thoroughly and drain all the water.
2. In a mixing bowl, add curd, turmeric and lemon juice and mix well. Add the washed chicken pieces in the curd mixture and marinate for at least 1 hour.
3. Heat a flat skillet and add dry red chilies, fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cloves and peppercorns. Roast them on low flame till the aroma of the spices wafts through the air.
4. Allow to cool.
5. Once the spices are cool, add them to a mixer jar along with the garlic and tamarind paste along with a tablespoon of water into a smooth paste. Keep it aside.
6. Heat a kadai with ghee, add curry leaves and allow it to crackle. Lower the flame and add chicken that is marinated with curd into the kadai and cook until the chicken has become firm.
7. Add the ghee roast masala into the kadai and mix everything together until it combines. Cook the chicken in the pan until the ghee separates out and reaches the surface.
8. Finally add in the jaggery, salt to taste and mix well. Once the jaggery has melted, mix well and check for seasoning. Switch off the heat and serve hot.

title: Chowman Special Chicken- Recipe
method: 1. Chop few cloves of garlic along with the celery
2. Saute in broth with Salt, Pepper and sugar, added to some wine.
3. Add water for the gravy, and then add the sliced chicken portion into the gravy.
4. Finally Garnish with some Spring Onions.

title: Chicken Kabsa : Arabian Style Chicken And Rice Recipe
method: 1. Mix together all the spices in a bowl and set the spice mix aside.
2. Melt the butter in a large stock pot or oven on medium heat. Stir in garlic and onion, until onion softens.
3. Add chicken pieces and brown them on medium heat until lightly browned.
4. Mix, tomato pure, grated carrot, cloves, cumin, coriander, salt, black pepper and kabsa mix. Cook for 3 minutes.
5. Pour the mixture in the pan, let it simmer and cover the pot. Add chicken and simmer it for 20 minutes.
6. Gently stir in the rice and cover the rice until rice is tender and almost dry. Cook for about 25 minutes.
7. Transfer the rice into a plate and put chicken kabsa curry on the top and sprinkle toasted crushed almonds.

title: Malaysian Chicken Curry Recipe
method: 1. Make a thick paste of dried red chilies ,onion, pandan leaves, lemongrass, garlic and ginger in a grinder.
2. Heat oil and ghee together in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onion paste and cook it until fragrant.

3. Add the blended paste, salt, sugar and chicken pieces to the pan. Mix well and stir fry for 5-10 minutes. Now, Add fish sauce and pour some water. Let it simmer on low flame until the chicken is cooked.
4. Add Coconut milk and squeeze lemon juice. Let it cook for 5 minutes, garnish it with coriander leaves and chopped red chili. Serve it hot with rice.

title: Iron Paffles & Coffee Recipe
method: 1. In a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, mix the flours and salt. Add the butter and mix on low speed until it is fully incorporated and the mixture looks a little crumbly, about 1 minute. Add the water and mix until the dough comes together (4 minutes). Raise the speed to high and mix for 1 minute more, until the dough is smooth.
2. Turn the dough onto a floured work surface and form into a rough rectangular shape. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes.

3. In the same stand mixer bowl-this time fitted with the paddle attachment, mix the butter and flour until combined. Scoop the mixture onto a piece of parchment paper and spread it into a rectangle about ½-inch thick and 6 x 9 inches. Cover and refrigerate–monitor until the Tempe rates reaches about 65°F to 70°F (It should be able to gently bend without breaking).

4. When the dough and butter block are both chilled, but flexible, it’s time to lock the butter inside the dough. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out into a rectangle slightly wider than the butter block, and twice the length (12 x 10 inches). Turn the rectangle so that one of the shorter ends is facing you.

5. • Turn the butter onto the dough, positioning it so that there is a ½-inch margin of dough around the sides and bottom of the butter block. Gently stretch the top portion of the dough to fold it down over the butter block so that it meets the opposite edge of the dough. Press the edges of the dough together firmly all the way around to seal, then fold the excess dough at the bottom and edges under itself. You should now have a firm, but pliable rectangular package of dough (about 6 by 10 inches) enveloping the butter block. If the dough feels soft, refrigerate the dough for 15 to 20 minutes before proceeding. Otherwise, proceed with Fold A.

6. Fold A: On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to a rectangle about ½-inch thick. If you’re having a hard time rolling the dough, it might be to cold-let it stand at room temperature for 5 to 15 minutes. If the dough feels soft or squishy or melty butter is breaking through, it may be too warm, and may need more time in the refrigerator to firm up.

7. • Position the dough so one of the shorter sides is facing you. The first fold is called a “four fold.” Fold the top portion of the dough about three-quarters of the way over the dough. Fold the bottom portion one quarter of the way over the dough so it meets the left edge (it should look like an open book with an off-center spine). Fold the larger side over the smaller side (essentially folding in half), then wrap and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.

8. • Fold B: On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a rectangle about ½-inch thick. The next fold is called a “three fold.” Face the dough so that one of the shorter sides of the rectangle is facing you. Fold the top portion of the dough about on third of the way over the dough. Do the same with the right edge, folding it one third of the way over, resting it on top of the other piece just folded (like the way you’d fold a standard piece of paper to fit into an envelope). Wrap and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.
9. Fold C: Repeat steps 6 through 7 to perform another “four fold.”
10. Fold D: Repeat step 8 to perform another “three fold.”

11. After the final fold, the dough should be tightly wrapped in plastic wrap and refrigerated for at least 12 hours before using (and up to 2 days). For longer storage, it can be frozen for up to 3 months (thaw overnight in the refrigerator before using).

12. For paffles, we recommend rolling out the puff pastry to 1/8” in thickness and cutting the pastry to fit your waffle maker. It should bake for 4-6 minutes, depending on the temperature of your iron.

title: Chicken n Waffles Recipe
method: 1. In the bottom of a mixing bowl, whisk flour, sugar, and salt together. Create a well in the center and add remaining wet ingredients: milk, eggs, melted butter and vanilla.
2. Whisk until batter has formed and then stop.
3. Try to not overmix.
1. Plug in your waffle Iron to preheat. Brush both sides of the hot iron with melted butter and pour in your batter.
2. Cook waffles according to the recommended cook times for your particular iron.
1. In a frying pan cook chopped bacon to desired crispiness, remove from the pan.

2. Pour out bacon fat until 1-2 tsp are left, throw in the chopped walnuts and cook until lightly toasted and add 1/3-1/4 cups of maple syrup, after 3 min add bacon and spoon the maple syrup, walnut, and bacon topping on top of the chicken bites and fresh waffles.
3. Add powdered sugar if desired and enjoy!

title: Chicken Malai Seekh Kebab Recipe
method: 1. Grind all the ingredients in a mixer grinder.
2. Add bread crumbs to make a semi solid consistency
3. Oil the skewers, put the mixture on the skewers.
4. Bake the seekh kebabs in an oven until they are cooked.
5. Yo can also shape the mixture like kebabs with hands and cook it on a light flame in a pan using 2 tsp butter or oil.
6. Serve the kebabs hot with mint and coriender chutney.

title: Chicken And Corn Soup Recipe

ingredient.description: gms fennel pickle (optional, fresh fennel, cooked in salt, chili, sugar and vinegar)

method: 1. Saute onion and garlic in olive oil for 2 minutes.
2. Add canned corn and cook for 5 minutes.
3. Add salt and pepper and jalapeno brine. Add a little water and cook for another 5 minutes. Let it cool and then puree in a blender.
4. Heat it up again add cream and butter along with grilled chicken slices.Garnish with a fried egg.
5. Add fennel pickle (cooked in salt, chili, sugar and vinegar). Serve it in a pasta plate with a toasted garlic bread.

title: Murgh Kali Mirch Ka Tikka Recipe
method: 1. Cream cheese and marinate chicken tikka with cheese, hung curd, salt, red chilli powder, half of the cream, cornflour and all the powdered spices.
2. Keep aside for an hour to let the chicken absorb the flavour of the ingredients.
3. Skewer the chicken tikka in 8 mm skewers and cook in tandoor.
4. Dum cook the chicken in the oven, sprinkle kebab masala and lemon juice.
5. Garnish it with freshly chopped coriander and serve.

title: Roast Chicken Recipe

ingredient.description: Infused cold pressed virgin coconut oil – curry coriander
mixed fresh herbs – thyme rosemary and bay

method: 1. Preheat the oven to 240°C.
2. Remove the chicken from the fridge 30 minutes before you want to cook it, to let it come up to room temperature.

3. Wash and roughly chop the vegetables – there’s no need to peel them. Break the garlic bulb into cloves, leaving them unpeeled. Pile all the veg, garlic and herbs into the middle of a large roasting tray and drizzle with curry coriander infused virgin coconut oil.
4. Drizzle the chicken with curry corriander infused virgin coconut oil and season well with sea salt and black pepper, then rub all over the bird.
5. Place the chicken on top of the vegetables. Carefully prick the lemon all over, using the tip of a sharp knife. Put the lemon inside the chicken’s cavity, with the bunch of herbs.
6. Place the tray in the oven, then turn the heat down immediately to 200°C and cook for 1 hour 20 minutes.

7. When the chicken is cooked, take the tray out of the oven and transfer the chicken to a board to rest for 15 minutes or so. Cover it with a layer of tin foil and a tea towel and leave aside while you make your gravy.

8. To carve your chicken, remove any string and take off the wings. Carefully cut down between the leg and the breast. Cut through the joint and pull the leg off. Repeat on the other side, then cut each leg between the thigh and the drumstick so you end up with four portions of dark meat. Place these on a serving platter.
9. When you get down to the fussy bits, just use your fingers to pull all the meat off, and turn the chicken over to get all the tasty, juicy bits from underneath.
10. You should be left with a stripped carcass, and a platter full of lovely meat that you can serve with your piping hot gravy and some delicious roast veg.

title: Bamboo Biryani Recipe
method: 1. Take chicken into a mixing bowl. Add whole garam masala spices, salt as required, turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, ginger garlic paste, coriander powder, fried onions, half a lemon, yogurt, mint leaves, coriander leaves, oil and mix well. Leave it to marinade for an hour.
1. Take raw basmati rice into a mixing bowl.
2. Add oil, salt, whole garam masala spices, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, onions, green chilies, mint leaves and mix well.
3. Keep it aside for an hour.
1. Clean the bamboo until you find no dust inside.
2. Grease the inner part with oil.
3. Put 2 spoonful’s of chicken marinade first and then 4 to 5 spoons of rice. Repeat the process again.
